result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lester Brown

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lester Brown not in court.  Attorney Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for Lester Brown.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for calendar call.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued forthwith. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court takes no action as to bail. 

***

Recalled at 2:39 PM. Same appearances, defendant also appears via zoom. Court vacates previously issued warrant. Case is being considered for a DPA, defendant needs to complete a TAD evaluation. Case is adjourned in Branch 30.
Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Lester Brown not in court.  Attorney Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for Lester Brown.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. 
Court orders case adjourned for Calendar Call in Branch 30.
Calendar call scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Lester Brown in court.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lester Brown appeared by video means.
Case in court for a pre-trial conference.  Defendant does not qualify for public defender representation. Indigency Hearing held. 
Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by the court.  
Defendant agreed to repay Milwaukee County for the fees and expense paid by Milwaukee County. 
The court appointed Attorney Best to represent defendant at County expense at the rate of $100.00 per hour.
Defendant repay the County at a rate of $100.00 per month. Repayment to begin NOVEMBER 1ST, 2022.  Defendant advised failure to pay will result in a civil judgment 
Case adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 7/20/22. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Lester Brown in court.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/18/22 @ 2:30p
